newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan 1996/97 aluminium output rises to record.
newsitem.headline: Japan 1996/97 aluminium output rises to record.

text.p: Output of aluminium sheet and extruded products by Japan's seven largest fabricators rose 3.7 percent to a record 1.54 million tonnes in the year ended March 31 from the previous year, an industry body said on Monday.
The Japan Aluminum Federation ascribed the rise to continued strong demand for beverage cans, as well as a recovery in demand from the transport equipment and construction material sectors.
An increase in Japan's sales tax on April 1 helped boost demand for aluminium in the year, as consumers rushed to purchase big-ticket items ahead of the tax rise, it added.

Of the total, production of aluminium sheet, used mainly in cars and cans, totalled 1.22 million tonnes, up 2.7 percent from the previous year, the federation said. Exports of aluminium sheet dropped 7.3 percent to 179,581 tonnes.
Output of extruded products, used in the construction sector, totalled 325,592 tonnes, up 7.5 percent, it said.
